text:
Brewster is a city in Thomas County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 305 people lived there.
History.
Brewster was named after L. D. Brewster, a railroad official. Brewster was a station and shipping point on the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad.
The first post office in Brewster was created in September 1888.
Geography.
Brewster is at (39.362878, -101.376552). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Brewster has a semi-arid climate, abbreviated "BSk" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 305 people, 122 households, and 87 families living in Brewster.
Education.
Brewster is a part of USD 314 Brewster.
